Yesterday, England’s #FCERMStrategy finished its journey through Parliament so we can now put it into action. Here’s my blog about the strategy, the importance of integrated water management, and how we’ve been preparing for winter during the pandemic: https://t.co/XjrZih700g https://t.co/lTFZVCP1Ip

urls.title: The Flood Strategy is go!
urls.description: The Environment Agency’s Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy finished its journey through Parliament, meaning that we can start to put it into action, getting the nation better protected and prepared for the effects of climate change for decades to come.

tweets.text: @Plantzzman Hi, Thanks for contacting us. No, we're not near to concluding the case at the moment.

The #FCERMStrategy is now a legally binding document

It informs our future direction to help make millions of homes and businesses more resilient to #Flooding #CoastalErosion and #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/H11CyMb2v8 https://t.co/p0Yl8p64mZ

tweets.text:
A very special visit last week from Marcus @MumfordAndSons to the #LakeDistrict river restoration projects delivered by @ullswatercic in partnership with @EnvAgency and @herdyshepherd. 

Our rivers are no longer a #HoplessWanderer … #IWillWait for a better pun. https://t.co/SpTSapbOsd

tweets.text:
Transporting waste around the world is part of a multi-million-pound industry, and waste criminals can take advantage of this.  

Port officer Melvyn blogs about how he helps prevent illegal exports of waste to help protect our environment: https://t.co/p2B04tOYSo https://t.co/qCRbaZGPzr
We've been in Dorchester’s Mill Street today, testing a temporary flood defence that would reduce the risk of flooding from the River Frome #winterready https://t.co/ragNAZGZTO
@stwater @EnvAgency Have PM’s you with requested info

Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd is one of the judges on @BBCWomansHour's Power List 2020.

It'll feature 30 women who are making an outstanding contribution towards improving the world around us.

You can suggest someone who you think deserves to be on the list: https://t.co/oyfWf98cp4 https://t.co/dvj0xXjEj2

tweets.text: There's still time to register! Today at 5pm BST we're discussing the future of the countryside with @van_griffiths @EnvAgency, @Minette_Batters @NFUtweets, Mark Bridgeman @CLAtweets, Beccy Speight @Natures_Voice and @CrispinTruman @CPRE. Register: https://t.co/Gr180uODZs

@HelenBreakwell @EnvAgency @HelenBreakwell Hi Helen 👋 I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble. Could you send us a Private Message with your address and contact details? Do you have any Reference numbers from the initial report? Many thanks, Krista

Join @JamesBevanEA  on 13 Oct to discuss the @EnvAgency's new #FCERM strategy and learn about how the planning system can and should help create more resilience communities through the tools and levers at its disposal. Book your ticket now: https://t.co/ov9vcxNe0Q https://t.co/7AnKrO0LLs

Just doing my reading ahead of @LivingWithH2O board meeting tomorrow - so much great work going on across the partnership tackling #flood #resilience into the future. @YorkshireWater @Hullfloodrisk @ERfloodrisk @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @floodinnovation @EEIatHull @learnbyhand https://t.co/wrMMBgC46c

An online engagement platform has launched for the #Preston and South Ribble Flood Scheme. To register for the online engagement platform and for more details about the scheme, visit our page here: https://t.co/mvHsUm4PHo 

@EnvAgencyNW @LancashireCC #floodscheme #Lancashire https://t.co/T9lf5bew4g
@stwater we reported a sewerage problem to you some 5 months ago......It’s becoming a health hazard! @EnvAgency

Creation of riffles, pools and gravel beaches going well  today @ Kingshurst Brook Chelmsley Wood https://t.co/tS3iaC0iq3 @SoliLandscape @EnvAgencyMids @Team4Nature @WillPegg1 @SolihullCouncil @EnvAgency @WKWT https://t.co/MHu8VJREhp
I have had this little friend with me all morning. Her views on the systematic erosion of the @EnvAgency sewage discharge permitting system is unprintable. https://t.co/XDMZobMw6j

Teams of Environment Officers out in the River Lugg catchment #Herefordshire today.

Using latest satellite images to target fields at high risk of causing soil and phosphate pollution to local watercourses.

Farming Rules for Water require farmers to consider these risks. https://t.co/0EKLXI8eqC
@EdenRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW @networkrail @AquaUoS Excellent! I'm a Carlisle-based train driver who's been watching developments as I pass with much interest. Well done! 👍

@EdenRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW @networkrail @AquaUoS Fantastic! I visited a similar section of realigned channel at Thrimby with you guys and @EnvAgency FBG colleagues in Sept 2016. Where is this section in relation to that? https://t.co/EzJwzUKfUe

That moment when the water starts to flow in your newly-created, meandering river channel!  🌊 🎉 Phase 1 of our river restoration project at Thrimby Grange in partnership with the landowner and @EnvAgencyNW, with support from @networkrail . Design @AquaUoS #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/kw1LPtj5vL

tweets.text:
Today, EA Chair Emma Howard Boyd discusses how Energy from Waste permits and new incinerator projects are scrutinised, and the important public consultation that takes place beforehand.

https://t.co/xB8X23n1Ry

@TimCrossleyACC @SHinchcliffe @MichaelBrannan @bradfordmdc @kersten_england @KerstenEngland For those in Bradford City Centre, this is a temperature inversion. If an incinerator was built here, toxic emissions would be trapped in the valley, even more than usual. @EnvAgencyYNE why has no specific modelling been done for this unique valley topography? #keighley #bingley

📢Calling all conservationists🤿,photographers📸and fish enthusiasts🎣again!
@ZSLMarine are looking for more images of juvenile UK estuarine fish.
This time it's:

Cod🐟
Thin-lipped Grey Mullet🐟
Plaice🐡
Dover Sole🐡

Thanks to all who already submitted🫂
DM your best pics📸 https://t.co/4WoOT5YQTS

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

@AireIncinerator @SHinchcliffe @MichaelBrannan @bradfordmdc @kersten_england @KerstenEngland I hope Rob doesn't mind me using the picture, but does the phrase "out of sight, out of mind" ring a bell @SHinchcliffe ? https://t.co/0coABVvAzQ

Busy day today - Next stage of ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu Kinghurst Brook re-naturalisation project in #Chelmsley Wood planting 170 coir pallets and 1790 native wetland plug plants @mhclg @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Team4Nature @LoveSolihull @Love_plants @WKWT @SolihullCouncil https://t.co/TQU6Dy2C7T
@xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW Thanks. I have that one already bookmarked. Was wondering if this new meter would give us anything else?
@EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency Hi @EnvAgencyAnglia did the sampling continue throughout lockdown this year?

The historic concrete culvert in a tributary of the Torridge represented a barrier to fish movement. The old quarry track was no longer used and the landowner agreed to the culverts removal, opening up >2km of watercourse upstream to fish @EnvAgency #WEG #TRRP https://t.co/8096LIr5kJ

“The Environment Agency and Adam in particular were hugely supportive and as well as the vital match funding, which we wouldn’t have managed without, they also gave a lot of man hours into making it happen.” Happy to help @sportfishuk #RdgUK https://t.co/qUpIUFOT5H

Another view looking down the #fishpass at Bevere weir on the #riversevern which has been designed for #shad Video courtesy of Mike Winstanley from @severnrivers 
@CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/3tRUkqMnM8

Working with Canal & River Trust and River Canal Rescue the first boat has been safely lifted out for inspection at Weston Lock.  Marine surveyors are inspecting the boats. Canal towpath will remain closed for around 4 weeks to enable these emergency inspections to go ahead. https://t.co/S5CneNEOgV

tweets.text: Wetlands can play a big role in protecting us against the effects of climate change. Great to see @EnvAgency go ahead with their new floods strategy, making more use of natural flood management. Let’s make this happen, creating more wetlands as part of a #greenbluerecovery 💧 💙 https://t.co/f8ENvaXQuk

tweets.text: Another project completed in the Isbourne catchment....this one consists of leaky Woody dams, attenuation areas and the use of an old mill pond. #nfm #slowtheflow #isbournecatch #flooding #naturalfloodmanagement @worcscc  @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK https://t.co/D9HTSkyOQg
@davidpatrick @EnvAgencySW Yes it can be found here https://t.co/S75woMOvzJ. Thanks for interest

This is a particular problem in Powys - 156 intensive poultry units (IPUs) were approved by @PowysCC alone in the last 5 years, with 28 to be determined (as of June 2020). #WeNeedNature & nature needs us to take action; we cannot lose any more of our precious habitats or species. https://t.co/SKgOqSY0QP

tweets.text: 1/2 @EnvAgencySW @dartmoornpa @ExmoorNP @AliDriverUK  Here are live willow bundles that went into this Exmoor stream (really a ditch at this point) in March '19. https://t.co/8oW8Q8Daia

@ThomasRMurphy88 @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Almost looks edible.  
Amazing how this podzolic soil puffs upwards when given a chance. https://t.co/xdBWypH6tK
@Sukymac21 Hello - please report this to our national incident team on: 0800 80 70 60 - they will be able to ask more questions to log this as an incident - Eileen

Looking forward to present today at the workshop on Satellite applications for air quality and greenhouse gas regulation by @EnvAgency @NCEOscience 

https://t.co/Qp5iGAe7IM

Delighted to share our new paper 🙂 showing #nativewoodland establishment within #UKuplands is a rapid and viable #naturebasedsolution to alleviate  #soil compaction and increase capacity of soils to absorb rainfall with #ClimateChange. Thanks to @EnvAgencySW @rsmithsoil https://t.co/OKQHYzaCsk

@ThomasRMurphy88 @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance A vision for the future Dartmoor hill slopes.  
Stunning woodland. https://t.co/HOeIPI6cAL

New addition to the #TeamEA fleet at Selby Depot is this McConnel Robocut RC56. This remote controlled mower allows teams to maintain our sloped flood defences safely. It can operate on slopes of 55 ° whilst its operator stays safely on level ground. #flooddefencemaintenance https://t.co/ynxNiVxnad
@xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW That’s Market Street bridge isn’t it? Are we able to access the data it produces? I already monitor a few other gauges that cover the town.

We back the @RNLI #RespectTheWater campaign & the #FloatToLive advice. Help us share this lifesaving message. @MCA_media @EnvAgencySW @RLSSUK @Nat_Coastwatch @swasFT @NTSouthWest @CornwallFRS @CornwallSRT @cornwallairamb @surflifesaving @DC_Police 
https://t.co/3kgenwG7J4
